intro: Zosterophyllanthos telamon, commonly known as the Telamon zosterophyll, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the order Zosterophyllophyta. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring small, ribbon-like leaves arranged in spirals along its branching stems. The plant exhibits a primitive vascular system, with simple xylem and phloem structures that are indicative of early land plant evolution. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered an important subject for studying the transition from aquatic to terrestrial life in plant evolution.
